meanings.definition: A type of trousers worn by men in the Scottish Highlands.
meanings.sent1: In the Scottish Highlands, many men wear traditional trews for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: He bought a new pair of trews to wear to the wedding.
meanings.sent3: The trews looked like they were made for a giant, but they fit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: His trews were like a colorful flag waving in the wind as he marched.
meanings.sent5: The trews were so comfortable, it felt like wearing a cozy blanket around his legs.

meanings.definition: A garment covering the lower part of the body, similar to trousers.
meanings.sent1: She chose to wear trews instead of a skirt for the outdoor event.
meanings.sent2: The trews he wore were made of a thick, warm fabric.
meanings.sent3: The trews seemed to have a mind of their own, always getting caught on things.
meanings.sent4: Her trews were a shield against the cold wind that blew through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The trews hugged his legs snugly, like a second skin.
